newsitem.title: EGYPT: Egyptian suffocates to death while escaping Saudi.
newsitem.headline: Egyptian suffocates to death while escaping Saudi.

text.p: A 36-year-old Egyptian man escaping his boss in Saudi Arabia died of suffocation as a stowaway in a steel trunk aboard a Red Sea ferry, Egyptian security sources said on Monday.
They said Mohammed Abdel Hadi, a driver, had argued with his Saudi boss over his salary.
The boss took his passport as punishment and Abdel Hadi decided to return to Egypt in the trunk, taking biscuits, water and his savings of 5,000 riyals ($1,300).
Abdel Hadi's brother-in-law was waiting for him when the ferry, the Arish and Tour, arrived at the Egyptian port of Suez at the end of the 36-hour trip. He found the body in the trunk.

Foreigners working in Saudi Arabia require a Saudi citizen to sponsor them. Human rights groups say these sponsors regularly mistreat the workers, denying them access to their money and travel documents.
